Common.cameraPermissionTitle: "myTNB" Would like to Access the Camera
Common.galleryPermissionTitle: "myTNB" Would like to Access Your Photos
Common.photoPermissionDescription: Enable myTNB to access your camera roll to upload photos and save ones you’ve taken with the app.

Hint.mobileNumber: Please include the country code of your phone number.

SSMROnboarding.onboardingDescription1: Self Meter Reading (SMR) is a service where you can easily read and submit your own meter readings. We will send you a reminder when it's time to submit.
SSMROnboarding.onboardingDescription2: You get estimated bills when TNB meter readers can’t get access to your meter. With SMR, you will always get bills with accurate readings.
SSMROnboarding.onboardingDescription3: We'll show you the accounts which are eligible for this service. Simply click Start Application and get started.

SSMRApplication.terminateFor: I am unsubscribing my service for:
SSMRApplication.terminateTitle: We’re sorry to see you go! Can you tell us why you want to unsubscribe this service?
SSMRApplication.tncUnsubscribe: By submitting, you are agreeing to the TNB’s Terms of Use, Privacy policy, Anti-Spam Policy and Personal Data Protection Policy.
SSMRApplication.tncSubscribe: By submitting, you are agreeing to the Self Meter Reading Terms and Conditions, TNB’s Terms of Use, Privacy policy, Anti-Spam Policy and Personal Data Protection Policy.
SSMRApplication.editContactInfo: By editing, you will update your myTNB profile and electricity account contact details.
SSMRApplication.noEligibleAccount: Looks like your accounts aren’t eligible for the Self Meter Reading subscription.

Status.ssmrApplySuccessMessage: We have received your request for this Self Meter Reading service. For your reference you may keep the application number below.
Status.ssmrApplyFailMessage: It looks like we can't process your application at the moment.
Status.ssmrDiscontinueSuccessMessage: We have received your request to unsubscribe from this service. For your reference you may keep the application number below.
Status.ssmrDiscontinueFailMessage: It looks like we can't process your application at the moment.
Status.ssmrReadingSuccessMessage: Thank you for your meter reading submission. We will notify you when your meter reading has been validated.
Status.ssmrReadingFailMessage: It looks like we can’t validate your meter reading at the moment.

SSMRSubmitMeterReading.tooltipTitle1: Alright, what do I need to read?
SSMRSubmitMeterReading.tooltipTitle2: But wait, how do I read my meter?
SSMRSubmitMeterReading.tooltipTitle3: How do I enter these values?
SSMRSubmitMeterReading.tooltipDescription1: You'll need to read 3 reading values (kWh, kVARh, kW). Your meter will automatically flash one after the other.
SSMRSubmitMeterReading.tooltipDescription2: You can enter each reading manually or just snap/upload a photo, and we’ll do the reading for you.
SSMRSubmitMeterReading.tooltipDescription3: Enter the numbers according to its unit in the input. You’ll see your previous month's reading as a reference.
SSMRSubmitMeterReading.headerDescription: Please enter your meter reading for each respective units.

SSMRCaptureMeter.ocrReading: Please wait for a moment while we read your photos…
SSMRCaptureMeter.singleTakePhotoDescription: Take a clear photo of the reading value flashed on your meter.
SSMRCaptureMeter.editDescription: You can delete and retake the photo or adjust it before submission.
SSMRCaptureMeter.multiTakePhotoDescription: Get ready, you'll have 10 seconds between each value being flashed.
SSMRCaptureMeter.pluralOnto: On to {0} and {1} readings now.

SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Title: Uploading from your album?
SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Description: Be sure to upload a clear, straight-facing photo of the entire meter box with no shadows, reflections or flashes and the image can’t be skewed. Any of these may cause the value to be unreadable.

SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Title: How do I take these photos?
SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Description:
You'll need to submit 3 different meter reading values (kWh, kVARh, kW).

Capture the entire meter box with your camera directly facing it. Be sure to take full, clear photos with no shadows, reflections or flashes and the images can’t be skewed. Any of these may cause the values to be unreadable.

SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Title: How do I take these photos?
SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Description: Capture the entire meter box with your camera directly facing it. Be sure to take a full, clear photo with no shadows, reflections or flashes and the image can’t be skewed. Any of these may cause the value to be unreadable.

SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Title: Uploading from your album?
SMRPhotoPopUpDetails.Description:
You'll need to submit 3 different meter reading values (kWh, kVARh, kW).

Be sure to upload clear, straight-facing photos of the entire meter box with no shadows, reflections or flashes and the images can’t be skewed. Any of these may cause the values to be unreadable.
